about:
As co-founder and CEO of Equanima, an impact-driven startup, Iâ€™m leading the development of an AI-powered app designed to enhance emotional intelligence through immersive mood literacy experiences. The app is currently in private beta for iOS and Android. 

Additionally, we have developed an Emotional Intelligence Dictionary as well as games and specialized tools and resources tailored for mental health professionals working with chronic stress and trauma. 

Our vision is to empower individuals with a deeper understanding and management of their emotions, contributing significantly to mental wellness and emotional development globally.

Equanima has successfully secured funding from Enisa - European Union, including obtaining the notable Enisa certification for innovative and scalable startups. Additionally, the company has funded part of its products through a successful Kickstarter campaign.

My expertise also extends to the educational sector, where I served as the Senior Design Manager at Orval Art University, contributing to the development of the universityâ€™s e-learning platform and teaching as a UX professor.

I earned my MFA in Design and Technology from Parsons Design School, New York, and an MBA with a focus on finance and private equity from Eada Business School, Barcelona. Additionally, I have taken specialization courses in Stress and Traumatic Studies from the Trauma Research Foundation, Boston.

As a software developer with over 10 years of experience, I have a strong track record of building and improving financial and real estate software, as well as developing custom solutions for various clients. I specialize in Ruby/RubyOnRails, JavaScript, Angular, MySQL, and PostgreSQL, and have a proven ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and platforms.

My journey began in 2012 as a BI Developer, where I gained experience writing queries and creating reports for C-level executives. I then spent almost 3 years in this role at two different companies before moving to GestarCoop as a Back-end Developer, where I worked on a core financial software for cooperatives.

In 2016, I decided to become a freelancer and joined BeatCoding as a Ruby and mobile developer, working on a variety of projects for different clients. Overall, my diverse experience and expertise make me well-suited to tackle a wide range of software development challenges. I am eager to continue learning and growing in my career, and am looking for opportunities to make a meaningful impact at a forward-thinking organization.

headline: AI & Space Law | PhD Candidate in Civil Law @University of Valencia | SGAC Space Law & Policy Project Group Co-Lead | ITU Secretary-General's Youth Advisory Board Member
about:
Roser Almenar is a PhD candidate in Law at the University of Valencia (Spain), with a thesis on AI and Space Law. She earned her LLB in Law in a high-performance group (top of her class, 2018-2022) by the University of Valencia (UVEG), and her LLM in International Law by the Complutense University of Madrid (UCM). She has furthered her education in prestigious institutions, such as Maastricht University (the Netherlands); the Diplomatic School of the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs, European Union and Cooperation; and the European Centre for Space Law (dependent on the European Space Agency - ESA, France). 

Additionally, she has been an intern at the Cabinet of the State Secretary for the European Union, at the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs, European Union and Cooperation, and a Visiting Researcher at the CaÃ±ada Blanch Centre at the London School of Economics and Political Science (September-December 2023). 

Within the Space Generation Advisory Council (SGAC), she is a member of the Space Law and Policy Project Group, serving both as Co-Lead of the "AI & Space Law" Research Group and as Professional Development and Membership Coordinator, and she is also involved in several policy divisions under the Space Generation Advocacy and Policy Platform (SGAPP), dealing with European space exploration and responsible space behavior.

She is a research member of the Association for International Legal Research on Space Sustainability (ARIAS), where she also acts as Director of the Department of Institutional and International Affairs. She is also a research member of the International Institute of Space Law (IISL) Working Group on the legal aspects of AI in space, and currently serves as International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Secretary-General's Youth Advisory Board Member (2-year term), representing Europe.

Her research work focuses on the discipline of Space Law and Policy (dealing with remote sensing technologies, AI, and data protection, among others), and the impact of technological advances in the protection of human rights from a private perspective (Civil Law). She is the author of several papers published in peer-reviewed international and domestic law journals, and has been speaker at numerous conferences, both at the national and international levels.

She has been awarded the XIV CaÃ±ada Blanch Foundation - University of Valencia Prize (2022) and the VIII Queen Maria Cristina Prize (2023).

headline: Senior Clinical Project Manager
about:
I am a highly accomplished physician with a robust background in general surgery and specialized post-graduate training in aesthetic medicine. With over 17 years of dedicated clinical research experience, I have consistently demonstrated excellence in managing and overseeing all phases of clinical trials across diverse therapeutic areas.

My career is distinguished by a proven track record of ensuring strict adherence to protocols, regulatory requirements, and the highest quality standards. I possess exceptional skills in project management, clinical operations leadership, and cross-functional team coordination, which have been pivotal in driving successful outcomes in complex clinical studies.

Key competencies include:

Expert implementation of study protocols and conducting comprehensive site selection activities.
Meticulous maintenance of study files and adept handling of regulatory and logistical challenges.
Strong support for study teams and facilitation of effective communication channels to ensure seamless project execution.
Therapeutic Areas of Expertise in Phase I-IV Trials:

Oncology: Lymphoma (T cell), Bladder Cancer, Breast Cancer, Lung Cancer, Pleura Cancer, Prostate Cancer, Solid Tumors
Infectious Diseases: Wound Infection, Bronchitis, Chronic Hepatitis C, Pneumonia, COVID, Influenza, HIV
Respiratory Conditions: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Asthma (Pediatrics and Adults)
Gastrointestinal Disorders: Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis, Nausea, Vomiting
Metabolic and Endocrine Disorders: Diabetes, Osteoporosis, Gaucher Disease, Precocious Puberty, Renal Anemia
Autoimmune and Inflammatory Diseases: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Psoriasis
Pediatric Conditions: Asthma, Precocious Puberty

With a deep commitment to advancing medical research and improving patient outcomes, I am eager to leverage my extensive experience and skills to contribute to groundbreaking clinical studies and innovative healthcare solutions.

Letâ€™s connect and explore how we can collaborate to make a meaningful impact in the field of clinical research.

headline: Directora Adjunta Impacto Consciente
about:
Generando impacto social a travÃ©s del empleo
En 2018 decidÃ­ dar un giro a mi vida profesional. DespuÃ©s de una etapa de gran aprendizaje en una empresa que me brindÃ³ una experiencia laboral invaluable, sentÃ­ que necesitaba encontrar un propÃ³sito mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de mi desarrollo profesional: querÃ­a generar un impacto real en la vida de las personas.

RegresÃ© a EspaÃ±a y me encontrÃ© con Impacto Consciente, un ecosistema de empresas sociales que comparte este mismo propÃ³sito. Tuve la suerte de comenzar mi camino en el CEE Novaterra Social Logistics, donde pude ver cÃ³mo el trabajo del dÃ­a a dÃ­a, realizado por un equipo comprometido, genera cambios inmediatos y tangibles. Este fue un punto de inflexiÃ³n para mÃ­, y desde entonces, no he dejado de pensar en cÃ³mo aportar al grupo y seguir ampliando el impacto.

A lo largo de este tiempo, he aprendido que el impacto social no siempre requiere grandes proyectos; cada uno de nosotros puede contribuir con su granito de arena. No todo depende de la administraciÃ³n pÃºblica o los polÃ­ticos, el cambio real comienza con acciones concretas de las personas. Y si somos capaces de mejorar la vida de una sola persona, ya estamos generando una transformaciÃ³n significativa.

Hoy, como parte de Impacto Consciente, continÃºo comprometida con la misiÃ³n de crear empleo y oportunidades que promuevan la inclusiÃ³n social.

Si compartes esta visiÃ³n o te interesa conocer mÃ¡s sobre nuestro trabajo, estarÃ© encantada de conectar y seguir sumando esfuerzos para generar mÃ¡s impacto positivo.

headline: Transforming Business Challenges into Sustainable Success Stories | Sharing Insight on Marketing and Sales Leveraged with Technology
about:
Since I bought my first book on entrepreneurship at age 16, I knew I wanted to have my own company. That spark ignited a fire that has driven my journey ever since.

After gaining valuable experience in industries such as manufacturing, banking, retail, and technology, always in marketing and sales roles, designing, implementing, and executing expansion plans and strategies, I finally embarked on entrepreneurship at age 28.

My real breakthrough came when I ventured into the graphic industry for over 10 years. It was here that I was fortunate to have my brother, a systems engineer, as an external consultant. He instilled in me the unique perspective engineers have of the world, seeing everything as a sum of small processes converging into a larger one. This mindset, combined with my previous experiences, awakened my passion for transforming companies into more efficient and scalable models.

This is how Sention was born, a Growth Marketing Agency focused on helping B2B companies accelerate their growth sustainably. Together with the best talent I have found in each area, I dedicate myself to decoding companies' challenges and finding the best strategic and technological solutions. It's like having a superpower to diagnose complex problems and prescribe effective solutions when starting a new project.

This has become my passion and the leitmotif of my professional life. I specialize in:
â–¶ Growth Marketing
â–¶ High-Ticket Sales and Closing Techniques
â–¶ CRM Consulting
â–¶ Customer Loyalty and Memorable Experiences
â–¶ External Consulting for Board Meetings
â–¶ Entrepreneurial Coaching

As General Patton once said: "By perseverance, study, and eternal desire, any man can become great." This has been my mantra and my compass on this entrepreneurial journey.

I hope my experience and perspective can add value to your company on its growth path. 

Feel free to explore my profile to see how I can contribute to your business goals.

about:
With over a decade of experience as a lawyer in Argentina, Iâ€™ve navigated complex legal landscapes, advocated for my clients, and honed my analytical and problem-solving skills. My journey in the legal field has been rich and rewarding, offering me deep insights into human behavior, negotiation, and the intricacies of the legal system.

In 2021, I decided to take a bold step and transition into a field that has long captivated meâ€”Ontological Coaching. I became a certified Ontological Coach, driven by a passion for emotional education and personal growth. This career shift allows me to combine my extensive legal experience with my deep interest in human potential and emotional intelligence.

As a coach, I specialize in helping individuals and professionals enhance their emotional awareness, develop resilience, and achieve their personal and professional goals. My approach is grounded in empathy, active listening, and a commitment to facilitating meaningful transformations. I work closely with my clients to help them unlock their potential, overcome obstacles, and cultivate a more fulfilling and balanced life.

Iâ€™m particularly passionate about addressing and resolving bullying situations. I work with individuals, families, and organizations to create environments where emotional safety and respect are prioritized, helping those affected by bullying to regain their confidence and well-being.

- Bullying Prevention & Resolution
- Active Listening & Effective Communication

Iâ€™m excited to connect with professionals and individuals looking to enhance their emotional and professional lives. Whether youâ€™re seeking guidance on dealing with bullying or embarking on a journey of personal growth, Iâ€™m here to support and guide you.

headline: Applied economics / Smart Specialization Strategies (S3) / Open innovation and digital transformation / Business internationalization / ScaleUp Business
about:
I am Rodrigo, PhD in Economics at the Camilo JosÃ© Cela University (UCJC) of Madrid. I have extensive experience in business economics, smart specialization (S3) and internationalization of Triple Impact companies. My doctoral thesis was directed by the prominent economist Jorge Katz, PhD at University of Oxford and pupil of the Nobel Prize in Economics John Hicks (1972).

I have also completed a specialization in economic policy for social innovation at University of Oxford. During the last 16 years, I have had the opportunity to improve my knowledge in various disciplines in Chilean and European universities. I also hold an Official Master's Degree in Territorial and Environmental Strategies in the Local Level at the University of Huelva, and the CMI Level 8 Award in Strategic Management and Leadership from the United Kingdom.

I have developed different economic dynamics for global markets and associative economic models, with a strong emphasis on business and territorial intelligence. In addition, I have broadened my experience as a lecturer in the fields of social innovation, applied economics and development of indigenous communities in Latin America, giving courses and lectures at various universities and academic institutions in Latin America and Europe.

I have positioned myself as a specialist in internationalization and scaling of companies for the Business Development Centers Program in Chile. I have also provided technical assistance to international organizations such as the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), the European Union, the Spanish Agency for International Cooperation and R&D entities of the Valencian Community, collaborating with researchers and companies.

As an experienced consultant in smart specialization strategies, I offer an innovative perspective on the commitment to research and innovation as key elements for the competitive development of the territories. Finally, for my work on inclusive economic development in Latin America, I have had the privilege of receiving several awards in the United Kingdom, India, the United States, Spain and Italy.

headline: Business Analyst at Odoo
Senior Full Stack Developer - React / Node.js
Applied Economics | Smart Specialisation Strategies | Transformative Economic Governance |  Sustainable Business Development
about:
I am Rodrigo Barra Novoa, a Chilean economist and researcher with a PhD in Economic Sciences from Camilo JosÃ© Cela University (UCJC), Madrid. Over the past sixteen years, I have dedicated my professional and academic work to exploring the intersections between applied economics, smart specialisation strategies (S3), and the internationalisation of triple-impact enterprises.

My doctoral studies were supervised by Jorge Katz, a distinguished Latin American economist with a PhD from the University of Oxford and a disciple of Nobel Laureate John Hicks (1972). This mentorship profoundly shaped my academic and humanistic vision of economics. I later pursued advanced studies, including a specialisation in Economic Policy for Social Innovation at the University of Oxford, an Official Masterâ€™s in Territorial and Environmental Strategies at the Local Level (University of Huelva, Spain), and the CMI Level 8 in Strategic Management and Leadership in the United Kingdom.

Throughout my career, I have focused on designing economic models for sustainable territorial development, promoting business and territorial intelligence, and strengthening the role of local knowledge systems in regional competitiveness. I have taught and conducted research on social innovation, applied economics, and the sustainable development of indigenous communities across Latin America and Europe, convinced that true development must be both inclusive and culturally rooted.

I have advised Chileâ€™s Business Development Centers Program, supporting the internationalisation and scaling of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). My consulting work has extended to international organisations such as the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), the European Union, and the Spanish Agency for International Cooperation and Development (AECID). I have also collaborated with scientific and technological institutions in the Valencian Community, as well as with universities and research centres in Europe and Latin America.

I currently direct the Laboratory for Innovation, Growth and Sustainability of the Andean Macro-Region, a multidisciplinary initiative that connects economics, sustainability, culture, and territorial innovation. From this platform, I promote a transformative vision of regional development based on a situated knowledge economy, publicâ€“private cooperation, and the valorization of human and social capital within local communities.
